Who Is a Good Fit for Stevens’ Online M.S. in Computer Science Program?

Mastering Computer Science
Stevens Online
February 13, 20245 min read

If you are planning a computer science career, you’re in luck: now is a great time to be in the profession. According to the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics, computer and research scientist employment should grow 23 percent over the next decade, at a median annual income of $136,620. Over the same period, employment for all computer and information technology professions is projected to grow “much faster than the average for all occupations,” adding nearly 400,000 job openings annually.

If you are interested in pursuing an online MSCS degree – an excellent option for working professionals – you might wonder whether you would be a good fit for the Stevens MSCS program. Here are some tips for assembling a solid application.

Who Is a Good Fit for the Stevens Online M.S. in Computer Science Program?

The Stevens online MSCS program does not require computer science expertise or prerequisite coursework to apply. Students from all types of science, technology, engineering and mathematics (STEM) backgrounds can succeed here; recent undergraduates looking to accelerate their career advancement, career switchers and current computer science professionals all find a place in the program. The curriculum focuses on job-ready skills applicable across the profession.

To meet the needs of both beginner and experienced computer science students, Stevens’ online MSCS program offers traditional and advanced course sequences, each consisting of 10 courses (30 credit hours). Traditional coursework introduces students to Java programming and data structures before delving into other computer science concepts like algorithms, database management systems and web programming. Students taking the advanced course sequence explore agile methods for software development, human-computer interaction, and core computer science concepts.

Stevens Online Master of Science in Computer Science Admissions Requirements

Applicants to the Stevens online MSCS must have a bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution with a minimum GPA of 3.0. Current undergraduates may apply, although they must complete undergraduate study before beginning work on their master’s degree. Graduate Record Examinations (GRE) test scores are not required.

Stevens Online MSCS Program Application Materials

A complete application to the Stevens online MSCS program includes:

  • Academic transcripts from all undergraduate and graduate institutions where you earned credit.
  • Two letters of recommendation from faculty members or professional colleagues.
  • TOEFL/IELTS/Duolingo scores (if you are an international student).

You are also encouraged to include a resume and statement of purpose in your application. While these materials are optional, submitting them will improve your chances of gaining admission.

Are You Submitting the Best Possible MSCS Application?

As you gather your application materials, consider the questions below. Follow the tips to ensure you have done all you can to submit a persuasive application.

Are You Submitting Effective Letters of Recommendation?

You must submit two letters of recommendation with your application. Choose recommenders who know you well and who have a good relationship with you. They should be people who have supervised you at school or work, like a manager or university professor.

Approach your recommenders well ahead of the application deadline. The most compelling recommendations cite specific examples that illustrate your skills and qualifications. They also attest to your potential to succeed in the program and become a valued classmate.

Are You Composing a Compelling Statement of Purpose?

Stevens describes the statement of purpose as “optional, but strongly recommended.” Take advantage of this opportunity to demonstrate your interest in the Online M.S. in Computer Science at Stevens, your commitment to advancing your career and your English proficiency. Explain how your work experience and background have led you to pursue this degree; be as specific as possible. Detail your career goals and explain how the program will help you achieve them.

Keep your statement concise, and edit and proofread it for spelling, grammar and clarity. Ask a trusted friend or colleague to proofread it.

Are You Organizing Your Resume to Highlight Your Relevant Experience?

Like the statement of purpose, a resume is “optional, but strongly recommended.” Organize your resume to showcase your computer science-related experience and expertise. Highlight all relevant work experience, academic achievements and professional recognitions. Thoroughly proofread your CV before submission and ask a trusted colleague or friend to do the same.

Are You Consulting with a Stevens MSCS Enrollment Advisor?

Enrollment advisors (EAs) are experts in the graduate admissions process. They can help you navigate the application, admissions, and enrollment process from start to finish. With in-depth knowledge of the programs available in your field. EAs can help you identify the right degree for your career goals and prepare an impressive program application.

Why Earn Your Online M.S. in Computer Science from Stevens?

Whether you are an experienced computer scientist or a professional with a STEM background outside the field, the online MSCS at Stevens can put you on a career advancement path. The program is delivered 100 percent online, a convenient feature for students who plan to continue working while earning their degree.

The MSCS curriculum - taught by faculty that includes National Science Foundation (NSF) CAREER winners and researchers who consult with companies Microsoft, IBM, Google, Bell Labs, and other top industry firms - aligns with the latest industry needs and trends. Students develop in-demand skills in software development, web programming, mobile systems and applications, human-computer interaction, and enterprise software design. Stevens online MSCS students also take courses that develop proficiency in leading industry tools, including Java, Python, and C++, cloud computing, and machine learning.

The quality and value of the Stevens MSCS program is reflected in the fact that 97 percent of its computer science graduates accept jobs within three months of graduation. Stevens is also ranked thirteenth in The Princeton Review’s Top 20 U.S. Private Schools for Best Career Placement list (2022).

Ready to take the next step towards earning your MSCS? Contact an enrollment advisor to learn more or to start your application.
